<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;59c31011.1503">   <title>Fast Track to FELTAG Conference March 26th - apologies for cross posting </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;59c31011.1503</link>   <description> Dear colleague,<br>Apologies for cross posting but this event may be of interest to you.<br>Warm regards,<br>Catherine   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T12:56:01+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Bone</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;59c31011.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;dae22351.1502">   <title>An opportunity to apply for free inservice Maths Level 3 Award and Level 5 Diploma courses at Bedford College from September 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;dae22351.1502</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting<br><br>Bedford College has 30 free places up for grabs to train existing Maths teachers (Functional Skills and GCSE) up to both Level 3 and Level 5 from September 2015.<br><br>There are 15 places on the Level 3 Maths and 15 places on the Level 5 Maths. Both courses are taught (not distance learning) and they will be held at the Cauldwell Street campus in Bedford. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T11:30:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Bone</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;dae22351.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;83a54cc0.1502">   <title>Developing Leaders for a Digital Age (Free Online Course) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;83a54cc0.1502</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting<br><br>*Developing Leaders for a Digital Age Online Course<br><br>*2 - 24 March 2015 *<br><br>This course is aimed at FE leaders and decision makers with responsibility for the learning experience, the curriculum, and the digital learning environment. We hope that through your participation in the course, you will make better decisions for your college in an environment of increasing digital dependence and in response to rising student expectations of their digital learning experience. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T15:13:04+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Malcolm Bodley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;83a54cc0.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;1fa94bb8.1502">   <title>FW: FREE ACER CONFERENCE 4 MARCH - "MAKING THE GRADE" FROM D TO C GCSE MATHS & ENGLISH WITHIN STUDY PROGRAMES </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;1fa94bb8.1502</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting<br><br>[square-dfe-logo.jpg]<br><br>[ACER.col.logo.Oct.06-3.jpg]<br><br>&quot;Making the Grade&quot; from D to C<br><br>GCSE maths and English within study programmes<br><br>- an FE Solutions Conference<br><br>When: 4th March 2015<br><br>Where: Shuttleworth College, Bedfordshire<br><br>Time: 09.45 - 15.45<br>(refreshments from 09.15)<br><br>Cost: Free to attend, although cancellation after the 26th February or non-attendance on the day will incur a fee of \ufffd\ufffd50 per person to cover venue costs. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T13:43:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Malcolm Bodley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;1fa94bb8.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;eb443402.1502">   <title>E-learning and technical managers forums </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;eb443402.1502</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting<br>Hi All,<br><br>I suggest that we congregate on the 27th February at Shuttleworth College SG18 9DXwith coffee from 10:00&lt;calendar:T1:10:00&gt; onwards with a formal start at 10:30&lt;calendar:T1:10:30&gt;.<br><br>The theme is Responses to FELTAG - so we are looking for presentations and round the table discussion on how colleges have been approaching the implementation of FELTAG recommendations. Inclusion of eLearning content in Programs of Study will obviously be a hot topic - but input on other aspects of FELTAG will be welcome. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T11:16:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Malcolm Bodley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;eb443402.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;19648014.1411">   <title>Re: ProMonitor... </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;19648014.1411</link>   <description> Hi Ben<br><br>We use ProMonitor and I really like it but there are a lot of considerations to make before you jump in. We have only just started to use Markbook across the college and he biggest difficulty is working out how to track the different qualifications for different awarding bodies. Compass have some excellent documentation on their website for different test cases but it doesn't cover all examples. For example, City and Guilds courses come in many different varieties and the hardest I have found are the pass/fail versions with their huge number of criteria. In fact, it is [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-07T09:39:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chris Ash</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;19648014.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;41f769e5.1411">   <title>Invitation to Jisc FE Digital Student consultation events </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;41f769e5.1411</link>   <description> Dear Colleague,<br>We warmly invite you to take part in one of a series of national consultation events being run as part of our FE Digital Student project&lt;http://bit.ly/FEDigitalstudent&gt; from January to April 2015.<br>This Jisc project is exploring FE learners’ expectations and experiences of technology and future work will expand the remit to the wider FE and Skills sector. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-07T07:13:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bodley, Malcolm</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;41f769e5.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;1ae24d3d.1411">   <title>ProMonitor... </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;1ae24d3d.1411</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>Are there any other providers out there using ProMonitor for tracking and ILPs?<br><br>If so I would like to know:<br><br>1. What your experience has been using it with both staff and students. Do they engage with it well?<br>2. Does it effectively support tracking for all of the qualifications you offer?<br>3. Have you encountered any issues that have prevented uptake. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-06T17:26:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Hutchens</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;1ae24d3d.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;dd091ff9.1408">   <title>Learning Futures Programme | ITT Opportunity | Closing date 26/09/2014 - Funding portal goes live on 26th August </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;dd091ff9.1408</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting    </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-18T09:18:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bone, Catherine</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;dd091ff9.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;480aeb04.1407">   <title>Jisc Digital Student [registrations of interest sought] </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;480aeb04.1407</link>   <description> Dear Colleague<br><br>In case you are interested in participating please see full details from the link below. (Note to register interest online by 30th July)<br><br>http://digitalstudent.jiscinvolve.org/wp/fe-and-skills-digital-student-study/call-for-institutional-expressions-of-interest-in-the-fe-skills-study/<br><br>"We would like to invite you to contribute to our investigation of Further Education learners' expectations and experiences of their digital learning environment. The FE Digital Student project is part of the Jisc Digital Student study<http://www.jisc.ac.uk/blog/students-experiences-and-expectations-of-the-digital-environment-23-jun-2014>.<http://www.jisc.ac.uk/blog/students-experiences-and-expectations-of-> The project is gathering evidence between July and December 2014. We want to analyse evidence of both staff and learner perspectives in order to make recommendations about the services that could be provided to support FE learners' use [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-22T12:07:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bodley, Malcolm</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;480aeb04.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;fd7a9807.1404">   <title>Scratch programming </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;fd7a9807.1404</link>   <description> Hi<br><br>I'm working with LDD students at entry level 1-3 and mainly teach ICT. Looking for new ideas, we tried the Scratch program in our ICT lessons for a couple of weeks last year and I'd like to try building on that with programming sessions over a longer period of time (a whole term, maybe). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-02T11:16:04+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sharon Stone</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=JISC-RSC-E-ILT-CURRIC;fd7a9807.1404</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
